fault_codes.troubleshooting_steps: 1. Check the gas supply is on and pressure is correct (19-20mbar). 2. Inspect the ignition electrode for damage or carbon buildup. 3. Check the electrode gap is 3.5-4.5mm. 4. Inspect the ignition lead for damage. 5. Check resistance of ignition lead (should be 1-5kΩ). 6. Test gas valve operation. 7. Check for blockages in the burner.
fault_codes.safety_warning: Ensure gas supply is turned off before checking gas components.
repair: If ignition electrode is damaged: Replace ignition electrode and gasket (part no. 8-716-142-100-0)
If ignition lead is faulty: Replace ignition lead (part no. 8-716-142-101-0)
If gas pressure is insufficient: Check gas meter and supply
If gas valve is faulty: Replace gas valve (part no. 8-716-142-412-0)
symptoms: Error code E207 displayed on screen

fault_codes.troubleshooting_steps: 1. Check electrical connections to the flow sensor. 2. Measure resistance across flow sensor terminals (should be 10kΩ at 25°C). 3. Check for limescale buildup in the heat exchanger. 4. Verify water pressure is between 1-2 bar. 5. Check pump is operating correctly. 6. Test PCB outputs to flow sensor.
fault_codes.safety_warning: Disconnect power before checking electrical components.
repair: If connections are loose: Clean and secure connections
If sensor is faulty: Replace flow temperature sensor (part no. 8-716-142-301-0)
If limescale present: Flush system with descaler
If PCB is faulty: Replace PCB (part no. 8-748-300-556)

fault_codes.troubleshooting_steps: 1. Check all wiring connections between boiler and controls. 2. Verify power supply to external controls. 3. Check DIP switch settings match the installed controller type. 4. Test for continuity in control cables. 5. Test voltage across EMS terminals (should be 12-24V DC).
fault_codes.safety_warning: Disconnect power before handling electrical components.
repair: If wiring is damaged: Replace control cables
If external control is faulty: Replace external controller
If DIP switches are incorrect: Set to correct configuration
If interference is detected: Install ferrite cores on cables

fault_codes.troubleshooting_steps: Check gas supply. Check ignition electrode and lead. Check flue for blockages.
fault_codes.safety_warning: Ensure gas supply is turned off before checking gas components.

fault_codes.troubleshooting_steps: Check pump connection. Check pump for blockages. Check pump operation.
fault_codes.safety_warning: Disconnect power before handling electrical components.

fault_codes.troubleshooting_steps: Check fan connection. Check fan impeller. Check PCB.
fault_codes.safety_warning: Disconnect power before checking electrical components.
Disconnect power before checking electrical components.

fault_codes.troubleshooting_steps: Reset boiler. If fault persists, replace PCB.
Check system pressure. Re-pressurize system. Check for leaks. Check pressure sensor.
